newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING says insurance results rise strongly.
newsitem.headline: ING says insurance results rise strongly.

text.p: ING Groep NV (ING) said on Thursday that results from life, non-life and general insurance all rose strongly in the first nine months of 1996.
Life profits rose 14.8 percent, non-life by 16.3 percent and general insurance by 17.6 percent, as total pre-tax profits from insurance grew 16 percent to 1.72 billion guilders.

It said stronger results from the Netherlands, Hungary and Australia were especially responsible for the higher life result, while sharply improved results in the Netherlands and Australia contributed to the non-life result.
The comparative period in 1995 was marred by a 60 million guilder charge related to hurricane Luis in the Caribbean, while the 1996 result was affected by a severe winter and U.S. storms.
ING said that within non-life, fire operations remained loss-making due to U.S. weather conditions, but motor results showed a considerable improvement in almost all areas.
Health results deteriorated due to the North American operations, while a fall in the accident result in the Netherlands was offset by an increase in North America.
Insurance costs grew 18.6 percent to 4.22 billion guilders in the nine month period, it said.
This was mainly a result of 150 million guilders of extra provisions for information technology, reorganisations, enhanced marketing efforts, the introduction of the euro and the year 2000.
